website_summaries.verdict: While it comes with a frustrating lack of polish, the Sony WF-1000X is one of the best-sounding totally wireless earphones currently available.
pros: Sony's WF-1000X totally wireless earphones are lightweight, comfortable to wear and sound better than the AirPods
They also feature active noise canceling, including a variety of tips to get a good seal, and their included charging case delivers two extra charges
cons: noise canceling isn't as strong as some people might hope
with some ears, the included wings won't help lock the buds in place

customer_reviews.title: Please read to understand the 1 star!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to get in touch with the manufacturer to purchase a replacement case/charger with no results. I contacted Amazon and Sony at their websites multiple times with no response. I am so extremely disappointed and frustrated. I don't want anything for free but I refuse to buy a whole new set in order to replace just the charger. Please heed my warning and do not purchase. The worst thing is I loved the product. I guess I will keep posting reviews about Sony and Amazon's disappointing Customer Service. My next step is going to be and the better business bureau and the CSA. I will be sure to post links for you to review.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Great features, but poor reliability and even worse battery life
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish were great right out of the box. Loved the features. When I first unpacked it, I was prompted to update the firmware. Despite several attempts, that process never successfully completed. After just one month of infrequent use, the battery only seems to last one hour. Particularly frustrating when using this on even short flights. Tremendously disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lew

customer_reviews.title: Given up with these - time to move on
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months I can honestly say every time I used these the right ear bud would keep cutting out and even go into a power off mode... yes, they were charged, firmware up to date and I have reset to factory settings at least 5 times. First cut out happens constantly 10 mins or so after use and then it gets REALLY annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Bikenut999

customer_reviews.title: Right ear bud lost connection all the time
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this ear bud. The right ear bud always lose connection, a lot of time ends up with only left ear has sound, right ear has no sound . I feel it's unusable for me. Suprise Sony release a product like this.
customer_reviews.author: MJ YEAH

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet/faulty battery
customer_reviews.text: Perform well except for volume. They are a little quiet to listen to, even at full volume. For comparison, I use most of my audio devices at about 30% volume. Was APPALLED that I had to turn these all the way up just to hear. They sit on my desk collecting dust and most of the time I reach for a cheap $50 pair of earbuds I got from a chinese manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Spiral

customer_reviews.title: cuts out a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the noise cancelling features, size, weight, looks. I can't stand constantly having my tunes cut out. I'm literally less than 3 feet from my laptop and the headphones cut out 6-7 times per song. They connect right back on their own, but its annoying, frustrating, and makes listening to anything an exercise in patience. Also, when connecting the headphones up to watch video, they lag behind the images. 1 earbud alone with the video and everything is synced up. Take the 2nd earbud out of the case, it autoconnects to the first, and then you get audio lag on the video. Makes me not want to watch videos with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: brewdude

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, while the batteries last
customer_reviews.text: They sounds great, they don't drop out like cheap wireless headphones I've tried, but the battery life is terrible. I often start a one hour run with 70% charge and they turn off before I can finish. The battery capacity of the case seems to be pretty poor too. The 70% charge often happens after they've been sitting in the charging case for a few days. I assume the case only has enough capacity for one or two charge cycles. I usually end up putting them in the case and then plugging the case in every time I use the,
customer_reviews.author: Chris P. Brent

customer_reviews.title: Not a second over 3 hours of battery.
customer_reviews.text: Max 3 hour battery life. ***I bought two sets of "open box" for ~$70 each, I recommend doing this if you can. I just swap out the buds when they die and I am never without :) Sound quality is pretty good. ***BT buds are never great, but these are as good as my Jaybird X3s Noise cancelling is above average. ***I have a set of the Sony WH1000XM2 and these WF1000 are almost as good. BT Connection is okay. ***This is my first set of true wireless, but it is definitely a step down from my Jaybird X3 and my Sony WH1000XM2.
customer_reviews.author: Andre T. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: amazing sound quality; better connection management
customer_reviews.text: updated the earbuds firmware to rev 2.0 via Sony connect. the sound quality is amazing! easy pairing via NFC (sony xperia, android). no more conspicuous blue blinking while it is in my ears. btw, got the used ones from Amazon warehouse w/o manuals or original packaging.. got me a little worried.. for no reason, really. Sony got all the manuals and some on the web (that's how I learned about the firmware update). it has a better connection management ang google integration like speak the text message in my earbuds, dial out etc. btw, Spotify has a stream for testing earphone; try it. I'm keeping this earbuds; great bargain at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dedde

customer_reviews.title: Good if the price is right
customer_reviews.text: These sound good, and the noise canceling is good. If your bluetooth connection drops, they will turn off, so you can't use them for noise canceling when not listening to something. Battery life is the only real weakness. About 2 hours is the most you can expect, and charging them in their case for 10 minutes might get you another 20-30 minutes. For that reason alone, they aren't really suitable for a cross-country flight.
customer_reviews.author: Rider

customer_reviews.title: The Sony 1000x is much better than the B&O
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the B&O E8 and the Sony 1000x. For me there is no comparison. The Sony 1000x is much better than the B&O. Read a few of the negative reports one hour battery? not with my set. The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is that occasionally there is a drop in the right side connectivity. I've used the earphone extensively and this happened about 5 time. I love the way these earphones stay in my ears without dropping. Wish I could say the same for B&O.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Johananoff

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Noise cancellation actually worked and the charge held for over 3-4 hours. Cons: The sounds is not as loud as other (even cheaper) headphones out there. The App leaves much to be desired, its buggy and slow. The charging case stopped holding a charge so now there is no way to charge the ear pieces. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY BUY SOMETHING ELSE>
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are amazing. I have been waiting for a pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing. I have been waiting for a pair of wireless bluetooth headphones like these for a ling time. the sound quality is amazing especially when using the large ear buds that create an awesome vacuum. battery time is a little short at 3.5 hours but the portable charging case can recharge them 3 times before running out of juice. they also have the lowest profile of any wireless ear buds. the bose ones are gigantic in comparison. not sure why these would ever get a bad review. love them!
customer_reviews.author: slynus

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.  Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. For a first product from a new company, this would be a poor effort. From a company like Sony, they should be truly embarrassed. Sound drop outs every few minutes (just on the right) with my iPhone and iPad and unusable dropouts every few seconds paired with my MacBook. maybe these work with non-Apple products. As they are for me, even at the very good price I paid, they’re too expensive. Utter garbage.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Worst pair of wireless earphones I’ve ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Horrible earphones, I missed the deadline to return and I regret ever buying them just because of the discount They don’t stay on my ear. There is too much of fading going on between the left and right ear although my phone is less than 5 ft from me It is an attrocity to take phone calls on one ear when you have both earphones connected. To top that off, You can’t switch between left and right ear to answer a phone call.
customer_reviews.author: Trial Basis

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds were of low quality. They had constant background "hissing". Also they had a 2 to 3 second delay making them useless for watching video. We suspect they are knockoffs.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but phone conversation in left ear only is a big no-no! I have tried the new Bose that didn’t block surrounding sound at all, the Jabra that would unpair or break off when switching apps. This one is good for music. Not for video because of the sound delay. Battery can’t hold 2 hours straight of music and after not even a year of use dies within an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Madspam

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected from Sony
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure a defective or refurbished pair was sent for the price of new one. 1) DEAD connectivity and sound on startup, 2) intermittent bluetooth connection, 3) Headphones SWITCHOFF abruptly, 4) Continuous fluctuation in both earpieces, 5) Update failed 9 times and if you select Later then it say "update is recommended for better performance, 6) I would say don't buy if you are an iphone user 7) every 15 minutes straight usage reduces 30% battery
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Trash. Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Trash. Absolute trash. Audio quality is decent once you figure out to change the audio quality vs stabilty setting but then the 2nd earbud randomly cuts out, and with 3hrs max listening time they're pretty useless outside of home
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: For $69, OK
customer_reviews.text: Good sound. Meh ANC. Short battery life. However, for $69, the ANC does make some difference, the sound is pretty good, and I can still get around 3 hours. Comfortable fit. Calls only out of 1 earbud, however. Imperfect, sure, but the compromises are acceptable at this price range. If you just need a knock around pair with good sound, some mild ANC for the gym, etc., these fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: hifi80sman

customer_reviews.title: Very very good.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds incredible. Customer service was great, amazon, not so much. Received the item a week later after my promised prime two day shipping. All amazon did was credit me another month of prime. Big deal huh? Seller did try to contact amazon on my behalf. The earphones work well, but there is serious latency when watching video, like many bluetooth headphones. Updating the firmware was a nightmare, finally realized I had to power off my Apple Watch. Also, the right ear does drop a connection for a split second occasionally but I noticed that’s only when I have ambient noise cancellation on. When I use no noise cancellation, the connection is secure.
customer_reviews.author: Chi

customer_reviews.title: Important Notes
customer_reviews.text: If you buy these headphones, make sure to get Sony's headphones and music player apps. The music player app will allow you to turn up the max volume of the earbuds and the headphones app allows you to change different settings on the earbuds and update the firmware of the earbuds. Overall these are good earbuds but the ambient and noise cancelling features do not work well enough to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy J. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$$
customer_reviews.text: I can't say how disappointing these headphones are. They rarely charge beyond 20%. Getting them to pair is a nightmare. And the sound constantly cuts out. I end up using my wired pair more times than not. Don't waste your money. These didn't last 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: authorwjf

customer_reviews.title: Wait for the second generation
customer_reviews.text: + They sound great + lightweight - right unit can be flakey. Today it is dropping out for a few seconds every time I turn my head (regardless of where the handset is). Most days it works perfectly... more atmospheric interference today perhaps? I've actually found it to be more stable on the quality setting than stability - go figure?! - noise cancelling is ineffective. A good passive seal will do just as much. - they stick further out than I’d hoped - they're not subtle! Not as much as the Bose, but not as close as the Samsungs
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy them for the NC feature.
customer_reviews.text: I have tested different sets with ANC/Ai NC from Sony, and these virtually have no NC suppression. But my real problem is with volume control, which is either making it a bit too loud, or barely audible. Turning on eq to bass boost (connect app) seems to have improved that to a level where its not an issue anymore, but for the fact that the over the ear aren't much more expensive, ill switch.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not what they say, don't work
customer_reviews.text: These have ZERO noise cancellation, Batteries go dead within 2 hours and.................. Disconnect and cut out consistently. I missed my return window or I would have sent these back !!!
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: wireless noise cansellar WF-1000X performs very good sound quality and easy to use for last three ...
customer_reviews.text: Sony, wireless noise cansellar WF-1000X performs very good sound quality and easy to use for last three weeks from day 1. Only my complaint or awkward part of this product is, battery life, which become out of service 3 hours and 5 Minutes (so far my data shows almost same working length) which should be 5 hours if possible as East to West Coast flight covers. Otherwise, I am very much satisfided with. Much better than Apple wireless. Bose one will be a tough competitor to Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Koshiro Hashimoto

customer_reviews.title: audio out of sync & spotty
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use these headphones to watch any videos, don't. There is such a big delay that the sound and video are off by about 2 seconds. Bluetooth is sometimes spotty causing audio to shuffle between the two earbuds and the battery life is painfully small. If you can see past all of that, the audio quality is very good. Back to Amazon you go!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, quwstionable noise cancelling capability.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, though a little weak on bass. The battery life (without placing back into the charging case) is 2 1/2 hours at best. I can't hear any difference with the noise cancellation on. though I have not tried it on a plane yet. However, with them in your ear and music playing, it pretty much blocks outside noise in the office place (noise cancelling off). I try to run with noise cancelling off in order to prolong battery life, since it doesn't appear to make a difference on noise. The only problem is, it also doesn't appear to make a difference on battery life either.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: cut in and out. don't buy
customer_reviews.text: would cut in and out, repeatedly, regardless of their advice/troubleshooting guide. waste of money. seriously, you read this review and are like, nah, i bet they work. no, they really don't.
customer_reviews.author: JJLS

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful.  Should never have been brought to market....
customer_reviews.text: Literally awful. I picked up on a great deal and thought i would give them a shot. Terrible performance, mediocre sound, Constant cutouts and lousy outgoing mic mean that they went back....
customer_reviews.author: The Honest Tech Review Guy

customer_reviews.title: Connection problems and poor ANC, avoid
customer_reviews.text: Right bud is supposed to connect to left but they goes rarely automatically an requires a number of tries. When it's finally connected it often cuts out temporarily. Also, active noise cancellation is placebo at best
customer_reviews.author: mergenbeen

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted these to work. Sound quality is flat no highs or lows. Battery on ear pieces only last about an hour and a half. Noise canceling works well, however when the flight is two hours long this just doesn’t cut it. Also right earbud would cut in and out randomly
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is abysmal
customer_reviews.text: The sound is impeccable and connecting is (usually) easy but wow... after getting the connecting charger sent back for repair, it STILL runs out of battery after 30 minutes of play. Also, the earphones need to be fully pushed in to charge, and they pop out on their own once in a while. I’m hoping it’s an isolated incident, but I really wish I opted for something else. Also, they’re pretty uncomfortable. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Mirela Merolli

customer_reviews.title: I tried. I liked. I disliked. I returned.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy, small and light, sounded good, app worked fine, charging case nicely done, battery life not long but more than I expected for something this small. At first really impressed. BUT No volume controls on the earpieces? 3 second delay when watching videos? Software update of 30 minutes only to fail three times? Those were dealbreakers for me for this version, but I will definitely try the next generation of them.
customer_reviews.author: SeS

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound quality in price range
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds have a very warm sound and the noise cancellation worked better then I expected. I really like that they paired with my phone very easily and battery life is fine for the amount of time I use them. I have had good luck with Sony products in the past and so far I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds Cut in and out when commuting
customer_reviews.text: I don't think Sony specifically designed them to cut in and out when walking but that's DEFINITELY what they do. From the minute I took them out of the box, I've had this issue. These just might be the worse truly wireless earbuds on the market. I gave it 2 stars because when they DO work (you'll have to be absolutely idle) the sound is pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: FABIAN

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but too many bugs and problems.
customer_reviews.text: Initially good but after I have had pairing issues, then problems with sound in both buds, and now finally impossible to update the firmware I have changed the review to a 2 star. These just don’t seem to be working well enough for the price they are sold at
customer_reviews.author: John Uppard

customer_reviews.title: Very bad product
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this crap. Connection drops all the time. No matter how good its sound is, it's useless when connection drop every few minutes. Faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Viet Truong

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, overrated mediocre sound quality and volume
customer_reviews.text: These aren't all they're cracked up to be. The Soundpeats earbuds have not only a louder sound, but a not dynamic range for about $25. Everything about these buds is mediocre except call quality. Bass is weak. Overall volume is doable but without the ability to make a good seal, the volume leaks out into the environment. Call quality is stellar. For the price, these aren't worth it even on sale. There are buds that cost half and sound much better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert William Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Phone calls only come in left side by design
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as they were a significantly lower price than usual and with the Sony brand, which I thought would be better than my Jabra Elite Active 65t similar earbuds. They do fit more comfortably but are not as good for music and the left only phone audio is disappointing. I'll keep them, and they are good for the $90 price. The Jabra are superior to the Airpods and these.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Pressman

customer_reviews.title: Shame..
customer_reviews.text: Keep losing connection every second Makes me crazy and annoying beep noisy sound at right side that hurts my cochlea and that scares me... Even bargain price, better to buy cheap none branded china product..
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Noise canceling leaves a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: There are many other lengthy reviews on these earbuds, so I'll focus on the noise-canceling ability. I find it to be minimal at best. Over-the-ear bluetooth models such as the Bose QuietComfort 35 or Sony WH1000MX2 are MUCH better at noise-canceling. The Sonys seem to have more isolation from the fact they are in-ear buds with foam or silicone tips plugging your ears. Turning the noise-canceling on/off doesn't seem to have much of an effect.
customer_reviews.author: kebel21

customer_reviews.title: Hard pass
customer_reviews.text: Barely get two hours of battery life. Noise canceling doesn’t seem to make any difference. I’ve tried NC in a few different settings but there no difference between NC, ambient and NC off. Sound is ok at best. I found that the fit in one ear wasn’t great, even changing the tips. Would recommend you go with something else. Even Soundpeats beat the noise blocking capability of these headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, great for public transit
customer_reviews.text: Great commuter earbuds. The adaptive noise cancelling is great especially for NYC daily life. They're a little bigger (understandably) than I expected, and stick out a bit from your ears. Also if you don't get them in right, they can get uncomfortable after awhile. Can't speak for battery life as I never need them for longer than an hour at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good experience with minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pair of truly wireless ear bud headphones. Overall they are a great experience with small problems that can be annoying. The right ear piece sometimes drops out for a second. The noise canceling is nice but isn’t as strong as other noise canceling headphones I’ve had in the past. My biggest complaint is definetily the delay when watching video. These are perfect if you only listen to music and podcasts but video is a different story. The audio is always lagging behind what is on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wuthrich

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for $70...still returned it....as they have very simple sound.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds very nothing....like old model...its a simple ear buds. Not worth the money....sony 700N are lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for $70
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wireless earphones, however only for the price I paid. I would not be willing to shell out $200 for these, and I only paid $70 when these were on sale. The audio quality is excellent and the equalizer in the app can completely change the sound signature. I found them to be comfortable and aesthetic while in the ear, however taste can vary. The noise cancelling is excellent, and unlike many other reviewers I have not experienced any connection issues or drops (yet). For $70 these are an excellent buy and outperform any of the unknown branded chinese earbuds on the market currently. I wouldn't spend more than a $
customer_reviews.author: Rishabh Rao

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Sony will finally make these better with their follow up product.
customer_reviews.text: They sound really good for the price and connecting to BT is a breeze, but there are two things that are very annoying: 1. Without warning they will 'die' almost every three hours requiring a recharge. 2. While can be a great feature, the ambient/adaptive sound control will keep beeping and interrupting your listening every time there is a change i.e. when you move, drive or stay put. BTW, the case easily scratches as you can see in the attached images.
customer_reviews.author: Idd

customer_reviews.title: Dont purchase these
customer_reviews.text: I never was able to use these as they had a battery issue with the left bud not charging. This has been reported by many users. There are a lot better wireless earbuds that you will have fewer issues with. Sony Support was of no help.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Disconnections with Sony WF-1000X
customer_reviews.text: Disconnections with Sony WF-1000X . I'm very disappointed with these headphones. I did all the reported actions to fix the problem. Without success. It's simply a shame that Sony continues to market the product and has not decided to pick them up from the market. I turn to the management of Amazon: You are giving a hand to a serious and consumer-damaging act. This product is not eligible for marketing. It's cheating in broad daylight. I have recently approached a lawyer to look into the possibility of filing a lawsuit for the sale of a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Yossi V.

customer_reviews.title: Battery buds
customer_reviews.text: The charge pack is a decent consolation for poor battery life. But an hour or so ain’t enough.
customer_reviews.author: derek domino

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling weak
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to reduce ambient noise volume in noise-cancelling mode w/o music. They did next to nothing to help.
customer_reviews.author: Don L. Parce

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I am unlucky or not, these ear pieces are damaged, battery could not hold charge, the left lost its connection from time to time, and the microphone sucks if you use them to make a phone call, no one could hear me clearly. However, customer service took good care of me, they replaced them by a brand new latest sets.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these.
customer_reviews.text: I had for a week .. used them regularly.. Battery life was terrible 2 hours at most .. sound quality was worse .. Stay away from these
customer_reviews.author: fore

customer_reviews.title: Love These
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for a few months now. Comfortable and reasonable battery life. Not great for phone calls if you are in a really noisy place though because the mic pics up everything drowning out your own voice. I don’t usually use them for calls so not a minus for me. The noise canceling and sound are great.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but unstable
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing this, I was hoping to replace my current BT headphones. The sound quality is great, however there is one problem, where the sound would disconnect from one earpiece momentarily, then reconnect. I also faced a problem with the sound not syncing with some videos, with significant lag between the sound and video.
customer_reviews.author: Sater

customer_reviews.title: I fell like these things have no active noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I'm sitting on BART, the San Francisco Bay area's notoriously loud really transit system. I just got it a flight from LA. After these experiences, I fell like these things have no active noise cancelling. Other issues I have had: 1) Walking down the street, the audio regularly cuts out of one ear if I turn my head. 2) Only one earpiece had audio for a call.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Wabekins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing from Sony
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing from Sony. Constantly cuts out in headphone mode. Battery life is not great. Not a good earpiece. In loud environments it picks up everything but your voice. Returning them.
customer_reviews.author: bnzuki

customer_reviews.title: Terrible audio delay
customer_reviews.text: When using these headphone for music it works great. If you're trying to watch videos there is a terrible audio delay, it's intermittent on cell phones, but on the computer or tv it's horrible. Do not buy this particular model if you intend on using them to watch videos or movies.
customer_reviews.author: QNZiNFAMOUZON3

customer_reviews.title: Battery deterioration
customer_reviews.text: It is inevitable that communication will be interrupted outside, but if you listen to one music in your house, it will be cut off 3-5 times. This is a great stress. And it consumes 50% in 30 minutes from full charge, when the battery is often deteriorated.
customer_reviews.author: alicia m. kim

customer_reviews.title: Sound and Noise cancling is great, battery is pretty short
customer_reviews.text: I got a refurbished pair and while i enjoy them, they leave me wanting in regards to battery life. I get about 2 hours before they die on me. Which being so small and light and doing so much it makes sense that it doesn't last long. They are extremely comfortable, the do not fall out at all. I have ran with them and put them through a spastic head bang session (purely to test them, the lost brain cells were for the sake of science) and they held on tight. So, great headphones, just don't expect them to last all day on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Battery life sucks
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound. Even like the noise reduction, which is weird because the music is not playing they're louder than normal. It's the 3hr battery that sucks. I don't always get 3hrs out of them, either.😡
customer_reviews.author: TRob ARob

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor Bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: The sound is really good and its comfortable to use, but the Bluetooth connection is extremely poor. The left earbud doesn't disconnect very often, but the right one disconnects all the time. You just have to cover your right ear with your hand to lose the connection. It's even worse if you turn the Active Noise Cancel on. The headphones also struggle with other devices using Bluetooth around it. I simply couldn't use it in train platforms and bus stops. I was very disappointed and I returned it. I'm waiting for Amazon to receive the product and return my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Varella

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even think of buying these.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how these work since they won’t turn on out of the box. No quality control at all.
customer_reviews.author: Foy

customer_reviews.title: Sound terrible
customer_reviews.text: Quality of audio is not acceptable. Mostly comfortable in the ear but I wouldn't enjoy these for listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Christian John Kreer

customer_reviews.title: just dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: do not buy it, I do not know if the seller has them on discount because he already knows that they are defective, but it is not correct. The batteries are ruined. You need to go to the nearest Sony center. Can you believe it? a new appliance in service?
customer_reviews.author: SammyHas

customer_reviews.title: I am a Sony fan and Sony really disappointed me this time
customer_reviews.text: I am a Sony fan and Sony really disappointed me this time. The battery life is definite shorter than described. The connection is very bad. It is very often that only one side of the pods has sound. The noise canceling effect is not as good as my Bose. Seems like a testing product. Not recommend to but.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great for a day of meetings
customer_reviews.text: So my average life of battery is about 2 hours. I did a lot of research before picking these up. I think the problem is that any battery will weaken over time and even if you bought them straight from the factory you should expect to only last a year or 2. I think they need to utilize a rechargeable hearing aid battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: True wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are the first true wireless headphones low profile. Sounds ok wish it could have been better for the price,also when ever you turn them off and on only one headphone will be on. Not sure if it's software related.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge properly and sound cuts in and out
customer_reviews.text: The charging device does not lock the earbuds in properly to activate the charge, thus the earbuds never reached a full charge. The earbuds bluetooth cuts in and out when connected to my iPhone, cutting sound completely out on a frustrating regular basis. All of this continued to happen even after a firmware update and multiple attempts at trouble shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Benton Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Not good ear buds
customer_reviews.text: If I could give them a negative on sound quality I would give them-2 No bass and the sound cracks ...
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Just ok Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, great price only complaint is Battery life. I'm only getting about 2 1/2 hours. That's watching movies.
customer_reviews.author: salvador armendariz jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones mostly for working out and have very little issues even while running. The sound is amazing and connectivity hasn't been an issue at all even at the other side of the house from my bluetooth connected device like Samsung Note 10 Plus, iPad or even Samsung TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, which I consider most important
customer_reviews.text: Sound great, which I consider most important. The ambient noise mode is only mildly noticeable. Was expecting more, I guess. The app and firmware updates don't seem to like iOS.
customer_reviews.author: JamesDM

customer_reviews.title: The noise cancellation sucks
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the noise cancellation. It would tone up and down depending on your environment and the person on the other line could hear the adjustment and sometimes it was unbearable. Not a good choice for me at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could not hold a charge.
customer_reviews.text: Found these for a good price. when they arrived I read the instructions plugged them in overnight and the left earbud could not hold a charge. Defective straight out of the box. After several attempts to replace the earbuds with Sony I was told the unit was out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Don Kostuck

customer_reviews.title: Design: 5 star Sound Quality: 2. 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Design: 5 star Sound Quality: 2.5 Star NC: 2.5 Star Battey: 1.5 Star Connection : 2 Star
customer_reviews.author: Charles Shi

customer_reviews.title: Sound, Connection, Noise Cancelling, Battery.  All Good.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for two month so far, and found these are almost perfect !! I live in NYC and use these for my round trip commute to the office. Sometimes I use these while exercise at gym. Paired with a iPhone 6. My daily commute is 1 hour and I usually work out for 2 hours at the gym. Note; these pairs are not water resident so I am very careful not to get these wet. In my case above, Sound, Connection, Noise Cancelling, Battery are almost perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KYTH

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connection, frequently skips
customer_reviews.text: What an awful product. I was aware of the poor battery life even before the purchase but what I really hate is that it hardly ever connects to my iPhone. I have 2 other Sony Bluetooth headphones and they’re performing great. I expected this to fare just as well but I’m extremely disappointed. I hardly ever get to use it because of the music skips, more times than I can count in just one song. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Alman

customer_reviews.title: Not great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not so happy with the noise canceling, and they make the inside of my ear feel weird I would not recommend theses
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Operational use easy.
customer_reviews.text: I would like to thank the person I bought it from. I got a good deal. Just Sony messed this up. Keep going in and out. Updating is hell.
customer_reviews.author: Masami Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation falls WAY short of my Hope's. Battery lasts just a couple of hours. My non-noise-canceling RayCons are far superior, with insane battery life and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: KnotGordian

customer_reviews.title: Would not reccomend
customer_reviews.text: The headphones didn't look bad but the sound was terrible. They weren't all that loud and when listening to music there was a weird buzzing sound. It almost sounds like the music is underwater. Overall if you're just looking of sound to enter you ear canal these will do the job but if you're looking for good quality sound these aren't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Im_Not_Crazy_Just_A_Fangirl

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancelling for tiny buds!
customer_reviews.text: Sound on these little guys are really good and ANC works but only if you secure it well enough into your ear. Like a tight seal but it's definitely there.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: it looks very cool. But the noise cancelling level is not as ...
customer_reviews.text: it looks very cool. But the noise cancelling level is not as good as the advertisement, even not good as my old sony earphone. The biggest problem is its right side earphone sometimes disconnect. Left side earphone connets better than the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad that I held out and found this seller.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, and better than I had hoped. I'd been holding out on buying a pair of wireless headphones because they were so costly for the good ones. I'm glad that I held out and found this seller. Below retail for new headphones! And they came still packaged as if I had bought it new. Everything works great, and I'm really stoked about my purchase. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney S.

customer_reviews.title: The connection keeps dropping
customer_reviews.text: This will be the most shameful product Sony has ever released. It sounds really fancy when it came with the tag like 'noise cancelling'. I believe lots of people, me as a most excited loyal Sony product fanatic, brought one pair immediately without any concern. But I need to say: wireless is wireless, which means connection really matters and can be the least but most necessary to evaluate a wireless earphones. This wireless earbuds worth nothing. It is a kind of waste of money and also time. Believe me. Never buy. Keeping Dropping makes you mad, always.
customer_reviews.author: AsianApple

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I opened them, the right earpiece would cut out intermittently. I tried everything to troubleshoot with adjusting the recommended settings to no avail. Sound cancellation doesn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Wireless Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. Excellent sound quality, well made, durable, reasonably long battery life. If you are an audiophile you'll love these.
customer_reviews.author: Havamal

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Just not quite there yet. A few hours of battery life, sticks out of my ears a bit too much, and no music controls. Plus is noise cancellation and sounds good. App is ok
customer_reviews.author: Prev

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best noise reduction in the industry - particularly on an in-ear bud.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price little to low and battery less for only 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: Got it on sale for a very good price, the volume is a little to low and battery less for only 2 hours other than that not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Rudolf S.

customer_reviews.title: Returning it!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I’m returning this set. I found the overall device to be sub-par. Volume was lacking, playtime was about 2.5 hours max or even less, and it lags terribly - connection also breaks at times. Positives include fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michiii07

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and design but the battery life leaves something to be desired. Two hours max. Noise Cancellation is fair, not great. But sound is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: kwk

customer_reviews.title: In comparison to the Jaybird Run these are much better. I have been using the Sony MDR-EX210B/BLU Earbud ...
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to the Jaybird Run these are much better. I have been using the Sony MDR-EX210B/BLU Earbud Style Headphones for the last 5 years. These wireless are very comparable. They also have paired with the Mighty Spotify Player. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Basque

customer_reviews.title: Very Good product when it works
customer_reviews.text: Very Good product when it works. Had to return the product twice due to inconsistencies in blue tooth pairing of right earpiece with left ear piece. Each time was able to use it for 1-2 days only before I experienced the connectivity issues which increased day by day to the level where I could not use it at all and had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Srinidhi Acharya

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish and perfect size. Good sound
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish and perfect size. Good sound, noise cancelling works well. Battery working time not so long, but fast charging time. Easy bluetooth connection however right earphone lost signal once in a while. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality. I hate to say it since I ...
customer_reviews.text: They loose connection often. Not the best quality. I hate to say it since I am such a huge fan of Sony, Samsung make a better product. The order Sony noise cancelling earphones models are amazing, these fall short..
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disapointing performance, specially in battery life
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality ok but the pairing,, range and batery performance make this earphones practically unusable, very poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Macias Martinez

product_meta.title: Sony Wireless Headphones
product_meta.description: Color:GoldThese true wireless, minimal design earbuds fit securely in your ears, and with digital noise cancelling, all you hear is your music. The Smart Listening technology can detect your activity and adjust the noise cancelling levels appropriately, and with a chargeable case, you’ll get up to 9 hours of uninterrupted, undisturbed sound wherever you go.
feature_bullets: True wireless design with uninterrupted Bluetooth streaming.
Digital Noise Cancelling lets you listen without distractions.
Sony|Headphones Connect APP for Android /iOS uses Smart Listening technology to control your ambient sound settings .
Smart Listening by Adaptive Sound Control automatically switches to ambient sound mode based on your activity. Ambient Sound mode to hear essential sound without taking your headphones off.
A 6mm driver for crisp, clear sound
Enjoy up to 9 hours of battery life with the chargeable carrying case.
Conversation flows freely with hands-free calling through the left earpiece. Leave your phone where it is: just speak with a tap.
In the box: Charging Case, USB Cable (1), Earbuds (Long Hybrid silicone rubber earbuds(SS, S, M, L X2), Fitting Supporters(M, L X2), Triple-Comfort Earbuds(S, M, L X2))

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars672 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
